pinboard 0.1.0
  • Reference

pinboard ðŸ“Œ

Full featured R API wrapper for pinboard.in.

The package allows to interact with bookmarks, notes and tags.

Installation

You can install the package via:

remotes::install_github("andodet/pinboard")

Authentication

To use the package, an API token from pinboard is required. You can get one from settings > password.

The token can be supplied to the package via an environment variable either system-wide or within the R environment:

export API_TOKEN=your_api_string
Sys.setenv(API_TOKEN = "your_api_string")

Overview

Below a few example of the main functions. Check here for full documentation.

Bookmarks

The package lets to dump userâ€™s bookmark collection in a data frame:

library(pinboard)

Adding a bookmark is as simple as passing a url and a title:

library(pinboard)
add_bookmark(url = "https://pudding.cool/", title = "Data viz wizards")

#> [1] TRUE

The API offers some endpoint for reporting usage over time

library(pinboard)
library(dplyr)

n_bookmarks_by_date() %>%
    arrange(desc(count))

#> # A tibble: 71 x 2
#>    date       count
#>    <date>     <int>
#>  1 2019-10-08    10
#>  2 2019-08-26     7
#>  3 2019-08-21     5
#>  4 2020-02-14     3
#>  5 2020-02-13     3
#>  6 2020-02-12     3
#>  7 2019-11-03     3
#>  8 2019-10-24     3
#>  9 2019-10-22     3
#> 10 2019-09-01     3
#> # â€¦ with 61 more rows

Tags

On top of standard operations with tags, it is possible to retrieve most used tags:

library(pinboard)
library(dplyr)

get_all_tags() %>%
    head() %>%
    arrange(desc(count ))

#> # A tibble: 6 x 2
#>   tag       count
#>   <chr>     <int>
#> 1 docker        4
#> 2 analytics     3
#> 3 gcp           2
#> 4 articles      1
#> 5 books         1
#> 6 hn            1
